title: How to Make Pea and Pecan Salad

steps.headline: Mix the pecans and sweet baby peas together.
Lay out lettuce leaves on each salad serving plate.
Pour an equal amount of the pecan and pea mix on each lettuce leaf.
Prepare the bacon.
steps.description: Cook in the oven at 400ºF/200ºC until crisp. Once cooked, crumble into smaller pieces.

steps.headline: Make the dressing.
steps.description: Pour the mayonnaise, vinegar and Worcestershire sauce into the salad bowl. Add the sugar and pepper to taste. Mix to combine well.

steps.headline: Add the peas, pecans and minced onion.
steps.description: Add the crumbled bacon. Toss through to cover.

steps.headline: Place in the refrigerator to chill before serving.
steps.description: Cover to prevent fridge odors transferring.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Add salad servers and you're good to go.

text: Pea pecan and corn salad Mix the pecans and sweet baby peas together.  Lay out lettuce leaves on each salad serving plate.  Pour an equal amount of the pecan and pea mix on each lettuce leaf.  Cover in mayonnaise.  Serve.  Pea pecan and bacon salad Prepare the bacon. Cook in the oven at 400ºF/200ºC until crisp. Once cooked, crumble into smaller pieces. Make the dressing. Pour the mayonnaise, vinegar and Worcestershire sauce into the salad bowl. Add the sugar and pepper to taste. Mix to combine well. Add the peas, pecans and minced onion. Add the crumbled bacon. Toss through to cover. Place in the refrigerator to chill before serving. Cover to prevent fridge odors transferring. Serve. Add salad servers and you're good to go. Finished.
